text: John Henry "Tripp" Isenhour III (born April 6, 1968) is an American professional golfer. Isenhour was born in Salisbury, North Carolina. He played college golf at Georgia Tech and turned professional in 1990. Isenhour played on the Nationwide Tour in 1996, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2003, 2005, 2006 and 2008. He was a member of the PGA Tour in 2001, 2002, 2004, 2005 and 2007. He has not played on either tour since 2008. ==Hawk incident== On December 12, 2007, while being filmed for an educational video, Isenhour killed a red-shouldered hawk by hitting it with a golf ball. According to court documents, Isenhour was irritated by the noises the hawk was making. He hit golf balls at the bird until one struck it in the head. On August 29, 2008, he accepted a plea agreement "to serve one year of probation, donate $1,500 to the Busch Wildlife Sanctuary in Jupiter, Fla., and pay a $500 fine. The former PGA Tour player was also required to undergo 40 hours of community service and attend a four- hour anger-management class."Isenhour accepts plea deal for killing hawk - Golf - FOX Sports ==Professional wins (6)== ===Nationwide Tour wins (4)=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No. !Date !Tournament !Winning score !Margin of victory !Runner(s)-up |- |align=center|1 |align=right|Mar 5, 2000 |Buy.com Mississippi Gulf Coast Open |−9 (70-75-64-70=279) |2 strokes | John Elliott |- |align=center|2 |align=right|May 4, 2003 |BMW Charity Pro-Am at The Cliffs |−18 (64-70-66-69=269) |2 strokes | Kyle Thompson |- |align=center|3 |align=right|Jan 29, 2006 |Movistar Panama Championship |−11 (63-67-70-69=269) |3 strokes | Kevin Gessino-Kraft, Parker McLachlin, Brenden Pappas |- |align=center|4 |align=right|Apr 2, 2006 |Livermore Valley Wine Country Championship |−9 (67-72-72-68=279) |3 strokes | Paul Sheehan |} ===Other wins (2)=== *1998 Trinidad Open, Kansas Open ==Results in major championships== {| cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" border="1" style="font- size: 95%;
